alert.note: Alert for Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 7:40PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Dare County through 845 PM EDT... At 740 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Albemarle Sound near Manteo, or near Kill Devil Hills, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kill Devil Hills, Manns Harbor, Nags Head, Manteo, Colington, Whalebone, Roanoke Island Festival Park, Jockeys Ridge State Park, Wright Brothers National Monument, Nags Head Fishing Pier, Wanchese, Bodie Island Lighthouse and Outer Banks Fishing Pier. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
